skillTree.localised_description: An unholy battle altar dedicated to the Great Horned Rat, the boiling fumes drive the protecting forces of the Pestilent Brotherhood into a frenzy and bring plague to their foes.

effects.description: Mount: Cauldron of a Thousand Poxes

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: As an aid to spellcasting, they are peerless. It is highly dangerous, of course, but a sure-fire route to limitless power.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +13% when increasing

skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The mere presence of Poxtooth is such an affront to the Lizardmen that their cold blood turns hot with rage at the sight of him. Exactly as he intends.

effects.description:
Attribute: Rampage for enemy Lizardmen units
	(enemy armies in local province)

Enemy melee defence: -8 for Lizardmen units
	(enemy armies in local province)
Attribute: Causes Terror when fighting against Lizardmen

skillTree.localised_description: As disease rips through all those around him, Poxtooth screams in ecstasy to the Horned Rat's name.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: So steeped in the toxins of his Plague Cauldron is he that Poxtooth emits vile pheromones that infect any who venture near him, even other Skaven.
An unholy plague distilled from the corpses of slain Lizardmen and swirled through a contraption of warpstone, it freezes in place all who are exposed, their bodies grown dangerously engorged.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Sworn to one another through rites that even the rest of the Pestilent Brotherhood turns their whiskers up at, the minions of Poxtooth will do their utmost to see him survive.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Guardian" for Plague Pontifex, Plague Priest, and Festering Chantor characters
	(all units in army)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Found only in the very depths of Lustria, and then corrupted by a process known only to Poxtooth, this vile substance eats at both the body and mind of the victims.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Pestilent Breath"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Pestilent Breath Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pestilent Breath Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Bless with Filth"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Bless with Filth Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Bless with Filth Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Wither Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Death Frenzy"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Death Frenzy Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Death Frenzy Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Plague Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Plague Monks

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pestilent Birth"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having to hide, for an extended period, in a dark, dank recess, in order to entrap and kill your target encourages lateral thinking.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +3% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +7% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +6% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +9% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing exactly where and when to strike is essential when fielding fiendish, potentially battle-winning plague-weapons.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +8% for Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +8% for Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units

	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one has seen the hideous deformities created by Clan Moulder firsthand and now fancies himself a dab hand with a needle and threadâ€¦

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror and Hell Pit Abomination units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +7% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror and Hell Pit Abomination units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror and Hell Pit Abomination units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one's intimate knowledge of the inner workings of Skaven machinery enables him to improve their efficiency on the battlefield.

Charge bonus: +6% for Doomwheel and Doom-Flayers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +3% for Doomwheels, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Gutter Runners, Night Runners, Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +20% for Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows just what to say to 'encourage' the very best work from his underling Warp-smiths and technicians.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Weapon Team, Doom-Flayers, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Infantry: +5 for Doomwheel, Doom-Flayers and Warp-Grinders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Weapon Team, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Weapon Team, Doom-Flayer, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere â€“ even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle â€“ spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +30 with the factions of the Pestilent Brotherhood
Plagues bolster your forces and nurture your settlements
Rite cooldown: -15 turns for "The Pestilent Scheme"

Passive ability: "Leeching Decay" for Plague Pontifex and Plague Priest characters
	(all armies)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases by each enemy unit in range with leadership wavering or lower.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Horned Rat Witness Me-Me!" for Pusbag, Rotten Rodent, and Plague Monk units
	(all armies)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base
Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Corrupted Mind" for all Pestilent Brotherhood units
	(all armies)

Passive ability: "Horned Rat's Pox" for Plague Pontifex, Plague Priest, and Festering Chantor characters
	(all armies)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent in melee or casting spells.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Once, long ago, the Clawpack of Poxtooth was slain by Red Crested Skinks. Ever since that day, he has dedicated himself to learning the vilest plagues and most tormented rituals, all so that he might torture the skinks of Lustria.

effects.description:
Gain following for 3 turns after declaring war on a Lizardmen faction:
	  Attribute: Mastery of the Elemental Winds for Festering Chantors, Plague Priests, and Plague Pontifexes (all armies)
	  Replenishment Rate: 15% (all units)
	  Charge Bonus: +8 (all units)
	  Ward save: 10% for Plague Priests, Festering Chantors, Plague Monks, Rotten Rodents, and Pusbags units
	(Lord's army)

Gain following for each active war on a Lizardmen faction:
	  Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn (all armies)
	  Melee Attack: +1 (all units)
	(factionwide)
